sentences.sContent: The financing of home ownership will continue through the 1990s and beyond.
sentences.sCn: 房屋产权的融资将持续到20世纪90年代及以后。

sentences.sContent: ...We have everything to gain by encouraging them to explore the world beyond their immediate experience and to prepare themselves for their turn at shaping that world...
...is what will ultimately determine whether the human race is living beyond its ecological means as it pursues economic revival...
...richer societies are able to provide environmental improvements which lie well beyond the reach of poorer communities...
...The idea is that we are taking more out of what you might call the planet's environmental bank balance than it can sustain; we are living beyond our ecological means...
...But we also found little interest in civic life beyond the tight circles of their family and immediate friends...
...The application of a technology can impact areas beyond itself...
...and are also beyond their members' control...
...These norms can take us beyond good intentions...
...and each group of workers in training has to know there is work waiting beyond graduation...

synos.tran: 超过；越过；那一边；在...较远的一边

phrases.pCn: [主英国口语]极远的地方；天涯海角；穷乡僻壤，僻远的地区，极偏僻的地方，内地(尤指澳大利亚内陆的荒野地带)

remMethod.val: “不一样的” → 不一样自然就越出其他的 → 越出； 香港红极一时的乐队“Beyond”就是这个词

trans.tranCn: 在…的那边，远于；迟于；越出
trans.tranOther: on or to the further side of something
